result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:30 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Dana Comeau via zoom, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson appeared via zoom and Travis Satorius in person, DF: Warren Scott Harer appeared from jail. Victim Witness appeared with victim. Court reviews case. S/T Inv. J. Shilts (SCSO). Direct by ADA Becker. Court notes record to reflect the identity of DE for today. Cross by Atty Satorius. Witness excused. No other evidence. Attorney arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court sets ARGN. Adjourned 10:02 AM  Arraignment scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Status conference on April 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, M. Bungum.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:17 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Michelle P Brekken, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Warren Scott Harer appeared from jail. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Atty Harrelson updates DE Address and DE is on a PO hold. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets STC. Adjourned 01:24 PM  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
